item.title: Red Hot Chili Peppers Start Dance Party at Lolla
item.description:
Red Hot Chili Peppers Start Dance Party at Lolla

Watch the Red Hot Chili Peppers get playful at Lollapalooza 2016. Updated with video of Red Hot Chili Peppers' Anthony Kiedis serenading festival sign-language interpreter Amber Galloway Gallego during "Under the Bridge" at Lollapalooza 2016. CHICAGO - Everyone who's involved with, attending or even thinking about this year's Lollapalooza has come down with a slight case of nostalgia.

item.title: Megadeth - Poisonous Shadows (Live) (360)
item.description:
Megadeth - Poisonous Shadows (Live) (360)

Get a 360 view of the band performing "Poisonous Shadows" from their Virtual Reality experience for new album 'Dystopia.'

item.title: Zakk Wylde: "Guns N' Roses Are the Zeppelin of Our Generation"
item.description:
Zakk Wylde: "Guns N' Roses Are the Zeppelin of Our Generation"

Over the past few decades, Zakk Wylde has somehow mastered the art of being one of the most influential modern guitarists of our time, but still staying under the radar. And while he isn't one to start many debates, this interview made it clear that, once he gets started on...

item.title: Back to Black: Remembering Metallica's 'Black Album,' 25 Years Later
item.description:
Back to Black: Remembering Metallica's 'Black Album,' 25 Years Later

Twenty-five years after the release of "The Black Album," Metallica are still struggling to recapture lightning in a bottle. For the first seven years of their career, Metallica's main objective was to be the loudest, heaviest, fastest, and most mind-blowing band on the planet.

item.title: Skrillex Talks Getting Guns N' Roses Crowd 'Semi-Turnt' in Opening Gig
item.description:
Skrillex Talks Getting Guns N' Roses Crowd 'Semi-Turnt' in Opening Gig

Amid a surprisingly drama-free reunion tour, Guns N' Roses made one of their most controversial choices for their Houston show in early August, choosing superstar DJ and electronic musician Skrillex to open for them at NRG Stadium.

item.title: Ronnie James Dio Hologram Debuts at German Metal Festival
item.description:
Ronnie James Dio Hologram Debuts at German Metal Festival

The fervent Ronnie James Dio fans who gathered to watch a group of the late singer's former bandmates close out Germany's mega-sized heavy-metal festival Wacken Open Air Saturday night got a big surprise: a theatrical performance by Dio in hologram form.
